verses.text: Give thanks to the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*for his goodness, his kindness endures forever.
Let the house of Israel now say: his kindness endures forever.
Let the house of Aaron now say: his kindness endures forever.
Let those who fear the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*now say: his kindness endures forever.
Out of straits I called on the \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*, the \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*answered and gave me room.
The \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*is mine; I am fearless. What can mere people do to me?
The \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*is mine, as my help: I shall feast my eyes on my foes.
It is better to hide in the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*than to trust in mortals.
It is better to hide in the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*than to put any trust in princes.
Everywhere heathen swarmed round me; in the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*I cut them down.
They swarmed, swarmed around me; in the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*I cut them down,
they swarmed around me like bees, they blazed like a fire of thorns: in the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*I cut them down.
Sore they pushed me, to make me fall; but the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*gave me his help.
The \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*is my strength and my song, and he is become my salvation.
Hark! In the tents of the righteous glad cries of victory are ringing. The hand of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*has wrought bravely,
the hand of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*is exalted, the hand of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*has wrought bravely.
I shall not die: nay, I shall live, to declare the works of the \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*.
Though the \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*has chastened me sore, he has not given me over to death. (The Procession arrives at the Temple)
“Open to me the gates of victory. I would enter therein and give thanks to the \+w Lord|strong="H3050"\+w*.” (The Welcome)
“This is the gate of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*: the righteous may enter therein;”
I thank you because you have heard me, and are become my salvation.
The stone which the builders despised is become the head-stone of the corner.
This has been wrought by the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*; it is marvelous in our eyes.
This day is the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*’s own creation: in it let us joy and be glad.
O \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, save us, we pray, O \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*, prosper, we pray.
Blessed the one who enters in the name of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*. From the house of the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*we bless you.
The \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*is God, he has given us light. Wreathe the dance with boughs, till they touch the horns of the altar.
You are my God, I will thank you; O my God, I will exalt you.
Give thanks to the \+w Lord|strong="H3068"\+w*for his goodness: his kindness endures forever.
